alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern McCurtain, eastern Franklin, northwestern Bowie, northwestern Morris, Titus, northwestern Camp and Red River Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Idabel to near Newsome. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Clarksville, Boxelder, Idabel, Broken Bow, Omaha, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Cookville, Wilkerson, Dalby Springs, Winfield, Talco, Avery, Millerton, Annona, Haworth, Garvin, Miller`s Cove, Rocky Mound and Beaverdams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
